required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Compound Edaravone Injection for Treatment of Acute Ischemic Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Phase Ⅲ Trial of Compound Edaravone Injection for Treatment of Acute Ischemic Stroke -- a Multi-center, Randomized, Double-blind, Parallel, Multi-doses and Active-controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of the study is to confirm the efficacy of compound Edaravone Injection via intravenous infusion every 12 hours in the patients with Acute Ischemic Stroke(AIS) in a double-blind, active-controlled manner. The study is also to examine the safety of compound Edaravone Injection for the AIS patients.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: The proportion of patients with mRS ≤1 on day 90

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of NIHSS score from baseline on day 14
The proportion of patients with mRS ≤2 on day 90
The proportion of patients with NIHSS score 0-1 (including motor function) on day 14, 30, 90
The proportion of patients with ADL-BI ≥95 on day 14, 30, 90
Ordinal Distribution of mRS on day 90

intervention.description: Compound Edaravone Injection 30mg/dose (Edaravone 30mg, Taurine 600 mg), one dose every 12 hours, continue for 14 days
Compound Edaravone Injection 50mg/dose (Edaravone 50mg, Taurine 1000 mg), one dose every 12 hours, continue for 14 days
Edaravone Injection 30mg/dose, one dose every 12 hours, continue for 14 days
Placebo injection, one dose every 12 hours, continue for 14 days
